programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Since its introduction in 1983 the Opel Combo has been very successful with both craftspeople and families alike. We took a look at the updated version. Also: with the XC40, Volvo introduced a new mobility concept called Care by Volvo.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Porsche packed a lot of power into the Panamera. We took their Sport Turismo model to the Formula One track in Bahrain. In addition: BMW redesigned their 530i Touring 4-cylinder station wagon. And: an trip to Cologne in the Volvo V60.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Beside SUVs, compact and city cars are on the rise. For many people, a Kia Picanto is enough to satisfy their mobility needs. In addition: the Audi A1 offers certain features of the luxury class, but at a much higher price. And: the agile Kia Ceed GT.

programme.title: Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10
programme.desc: The Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10 has its origins in the Japanese army. Its shape won’t win any beauty contests or achieve the best results in the wind tunnel, but this is not really the point with an SUV like this.

programme.title: Cadillac CTS-V
programme.desc: Those who don’t know about it will only see a dignified sedan but under the hood hides the 649 horse power 6.2 liter V8 supercharged engine of the Corvette Z06. This car is a good alternative to the Audi RS6, BMW M5 and Mercedes E63 AMG.

programme.title: Motorstories
programme.sub-title: Chevrolet Chevelle und Down Town Garage
programme.desc: Kati and Patrick from Munich are no longer satisfied with their 1972 Chevrolet Chevelle's 5.7-liter small block and want to buy a bigger engine. For that reason they visit the engine specialists from Down Town Garage for a proper conversion.

programme.title: Motorstories
programme.sub-title: Oldtimer Show and Race at Airport
programme.desc: Paaren/Glien near Berlin is host to the yearly Oldtimer Show. Frank and his crew from Special Cars Berlin take their Dragster Camaro to the airfield where high performance cars battle it out in a 1/8 mile race. Will Frank be able to defy the competition?

programme.title: Motorstories
programme.desc: With more than 500 featured super sports cars by Lamborghini, Ferrari, Bugatti or Koenigsegg, Germany is home to the world's largest Supercar Rallye. US car fans Kati and her husband Patrick take part in this event with a brand new Chevrolet Camaro.

programme.title: Bentley Mulsanne EWB
programme.desc: The long version of the Bentley Mulsanne is a prime example of a chauffeured limousine. With it, the British luxury car brand has set the bar extremely high when it comes to automotive comfort.

programme.title: Porsche Ruf RT35
programme.desc: Ruf RT35 may look like a Porsche, but it really isn't. Since 1981, the Ruf company in Pfaffhausen, Germany, has been recognized as an independent manufacturer. But the basis for its vehicles comes exclusively from Porsche. A Ruf is even faster and more exclusive than a comparable Porsche.

programme.title: Aston Martin Rapide S
programme.desc: Aston Martin is breaking new ground with the sport sedan – the „Rapide S“. Ever since the official car of James Bond became the Aston Martin, this brand has achieved cult status. Desirable, timelessly elegant, 2-door sports coupes are the DNA. But even the venerable British brand does not escape evolution - because with the Rapide S, Aston Martin goes new ways.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: British limousines are the embodiment of luxury, they are the automotive upper class. Built with the most exclusive materials, these limousines like the Rolls Royce Phantom, Bentley Mulsanne or Jaguar XJ combine luxury, comfort and power.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Whether it is the Mercedes S-Class, the BMW 7-series or the Audi A8, limousines "Made in Germany" are considered status symbols, setting standards when it comes to comfort, pioneering technologies and safety.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: International limousines by Rolls Royce, Bentley, Mercedes, BMW and Jaguar guarantee an exclusive appearance and stand for status, prestige and perfection. They are the benchmark when it comes to luxury and comfort.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Power limousines like the BMW M5, Mercedes-AMG E63, Audi RS6 and Mulsanne Speed offer a unique mix of style, performance and suitability for daily use. They combine the luxury of a limousine with the dynamics of a super sports car.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: They are masterpieces of automotive art, cars of breathtaking elegance, extraordinary performance, built for speeds beyond imagination: Bugatti Chiron, Lykan Hypersports, Pagani Huayra and Ferrari LaFerrari.

programme.title: BMW Kelleners Sport 640i Grand Coupe
programme.desc: The Kelleners Sport 640i is based on one of the most beautiful 4-door coupes. The tuning company of Ralf Kelleners, the son of a three-time European touring car champion, made a name for itself by specializing in remodeling BMWs.

programme.title: Volkswagen Touareg V6 TDI
programme.desc: Volkswagen subjected the Touareg to a radical makeover. After the end of the Phaeton, it's the new luxury top model from VW. Hopes are high: it has to sell big so that management can restore the peoples' confidence in the Volkswagen brand.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: The times when electric cars were slow and boring are definitely over. With its extreme power and performance the Croatian super car Rimac Concept One opened the door to an exciting new world. Also: despite its clunky name, the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Coupe Electric Drive was the perfect example on how the German brand embraced new technologies. And: Tesla's impressive Model S series.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: British cars are considered as elegant, exclusive and extremely stylish. The Bentley Continental GT Speed is a coupe with an enormous driving performance. Also: the Rapide S is a stylistically confident Gran Coupe. Despite its four doors it can clearly be identified as an Aston Martin, and its V12 engine is a statement as well. And: the Jaguar XJR, more of a sports car than a luxury sedan.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: They are big, heavy and embody the American way of driving, luxury SUVs like the Cadillac Escalade, classic pick-up trucks like the iconic Ford F-150 or uber-pick-ups like the Dodge RAM. As a driver of such a monstrous American you can be sure of the attention of others. But is bigger really better as well?

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: How do you enhance things that are already out of the ordinary? The tuning company MTM got to work on Audi's already super powerful luxury sedan S8. With their S8 Talladega R, the German tuners created a true performance monster. Their BMW-focused counterpart Alpina followed a different philosophy. The company's B6 Biturbo Gran Coupe easily beat its BMW counterpart and made the street vibrate.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Several years ago the 1,000 hp Bugatti Veyron started a new era of super sports cars. By now almost all renowned manufacturers offer their own super car. Many of these models today rely on hybrid technology or even drive in pure electric mode. We took a look at the sports cars of the future and tried to get an insight into the latest technology and planned or upcoming drive systems.

programme.title: Aston Martin DB11 - The first turbocharged Aston Martin
programme.desc: Aston Martin are pursuing future success with their DB11 model. Apart from the beautiful new design, turbochargers are used for the first time, but, not to worry, the magnificent V12 remains in place.

programme.title: BMW X4 2018
programme.desc: BMW's X4 is said to be the sportier version of the X3. We put it to the test at the BMW Performance Center in the USA.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: We present to you historic image and film documents from the Porsche 550 RS Spyder. And: how the Audi Quattro shocked its competitors with its driving dynamics.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: High-tech turbo cars from the wild 1980s are reunited at the Salzburgring race track. Also: the Lancia Beta Monte Carlo, a small Italian two-seater with mid-engine offers classic car driving pleasure at a low entry price.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The 1947 Triumph 1800 Roadster provides space for 5 fresh air fans. Also: Le Jog, the toughest classic car rally in Europe. A German women's team takes on the challenge in their VW Iltis. And: a charming oldie, the 1919 Wolseley Stellite.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: With the M3, BMW brought race car technology to the road. In addition: 120 years of Mercedes-Benz motorsports history. And: turbo power in the DTM. The Ford Sierra RS Cosworth taught its racing competition the meaning of fear.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: Cars like the Ford GT 40, the Jaguar D-Type or the Mercedes 300 SL wrote history on the race track and now break records at auctions. A sumptuously restored 300 SL will start at the most famous classic car rally in the world, the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Audi Quattro
programme.desc: Advantage through Technology on rally tracks. The Audi Quattro shocks opponents.

programme.title: Ford GT40
programme.desc: With their V8 cars, Ford showed that they were able to build race winners. The Ford GT40 was a prime example for that, especially in Le Mans.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: We present the most affordable hybrid cars. The pioneers are the Japanese, who have a huge selection of these car models on offer.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: We take a little journey back in time and trace the development of the modern car and show the ten oldest car companies.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: We present ten cars that have achieved cult status and are still adored by numerous fan clubs.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: Sometimes you really have to question the taste of car designers. We take a look at ten of the ugliest cars.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: They say beauty is in the eye of the beholder. We promise to remain objective when we present the most beautiful cars.

programme.title: Top10 Show
programme.desc: Car manufacturers regularly create special works of art that are limited, exclusive and therefore expensive. In this episode we show the rarest car models.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: Winning the iconic Dakar Rally for a record 13 times, Frenchman Stéphane Peterhansel had a rather unusual career as he switched from motorbikes to cars and was enormously successful with both vehicles.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: Alois Ruf is the founder of a small, but well-known car manufacturing company in Bavaria that specialises in building their own vision of street legal super sports cars on the foundation of Porsche bodys.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: From the 1950s to 1970s Hans Herrmann came to fame as a successful Formula 1 and sportscar driver for manufacturers like Porsche, Mercedes-Benz and Maserati who also won also the 24 Hours of Le Mans several times.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: People called her the "Queen of the Nordschleife" when she used to drive her Porsche or BMW racing cars at the Nürburgring's famous Nordschleife. Sabine Schmitz was a successful racing driver before she took a career turn by working as a TV presenter.

programme.title: Offroad & Fun, Part 25
programme.desc: Experience the blazing speed and heart-stopping stunts of Rally and Motocross.

programme.title: Offroad & Fun, Part 25
programme.desc: Experience the blazing speed and heart-stopping stunts of Rally and Motocross.
